content.title: Prime Minister's Scholarship Scheme for Railway Protection Force
content.beneficiary: Dependent wards of Ex/Serving RPF/RPSF personnel and widows (below the Rank of Gazetted officer)
content.details: Prime Minister’s Scholarship Scheme (PMSS) for Railway Protection Force (RPF) was announced by the Hon’ble Prime Minister of India in his address to the nation from the historical Red Ford on 15th August 2005. Prime Minister’s Scholarship Scheme for RPF was introduced in the Academic year 2008-09. It was introduced to encourage higher technical and professional education for the dependent wards of Ex/Serving RPF/RPSF personnel and widows (below the Rank of Gazetted officer).
benefits: Letter from Hon’ble Prime Minister for selected applicants
Duration of the Scholarship: Two to five years as per the duration of the course
eligibility: Dependent wards of Ex/Serving RPF/RPSF personnel and widows (below the Rank of Gazetted officer)
Students who have taken regular admission are only eligible for PMSS
Students should have secured 60% and above in Minimum Entry Qualification (MEQ) i.e. 12th Std., Diploma/Graduation
The scholarship is admissible for only two wards per family
Only institutes/universities/colleges having AISHE regulations are permissible
Students studying abroad are not eligible
No distance learning course is permitted
PMSS can be availed for one course only
content.application_process: Online submission of the Application form can be done through the website of the National Scholarship Portal.
documents_required: Service Certificate issued by respective offices of the serving personnel for category IV
A copy of the PPO/Discharge certificate/book for Categories I, II and III
Scanned copy of the mark sheet/Grade card of MEQ i.e. 10+2/ Diploma/ Graduation

faqs.question: What is the aim of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The aim of the scheme is to encourage higher technical and professional education for the dependent wards of Ex/Serving RPF/RPSF personnel and widows (below the Rank of Gazetted officer).

faqs.question: When did this scheme launch?
faqs.answer: The scheme was announced by the Hon’ble Prime Minister of India on 15th August 2005 and introduced in the Academic year 2008-09.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to get the benefit of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The dependent wards of Ex/Serving RPF/RPSF personnel and widows (below the Rank of Gazetted officer) are eligible to apply under the scheme.

faqs.question: What is the benefit of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The amount of the scholarship would be as follows: (i) ₹2500/- per month for male students (ii) ₹3000/- per month for female students.

faqs.question: How many students will receive the scholarship under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The scholarship will be given to a total number of 150 students in an academic session. Half of the scholarships are reserved for female candidates i.e. 75.

faqs.question: What is the minimum qualification required for the student to apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Students should have secured 60% and above in Minimum Entry Qualification (MEQ) i.e. 12th Std., Diploma/Graduation.

faqs.question: How many wards per family are eligible to get the benefits under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The scholarship is admissible for only two wards per family.

faqs.question: Are the students studying in abroad eligible to apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, the students studying abroad are not eligible for this scheme.

faqs.question: Is the distance learning course permitted under this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, the distance learning course is not permitted under this scheme.

faqs.question: Can a student avail of more than one course?
faqs.answer: No, the student can avail of one course only.

faqs.question: What types of courses are eligible under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Professional Degree Courses like BE, B.Tech, BDS, MBBS, BEd, BBS, BCA, MCA B. Pharma, etc. duly recognized by the respective Government Regulatory Bodies.

faqs.question: How can an applicant apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Online submission of the Application form can be done through the website of the National Scholarship Portal.
